urn:contentItem:6GH3-0XG3-RV2T-00T3-00000-00WEEKLY ROUNDUP: CANVA NEWS THIS PAST WEEK AUG 14, 20252025-08-15T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T07:00:52ZLexisNexisWEEKLY ROUNDUP: CANVA NEWS THIS PAST WEEK AUG 14, 2025

+ CANVA [10 Press Releases]

+ 5 LESSONS FOR GOVERNMENT TEAMS FROM THE CANVA PLAYBOOK

As communication channels evolve and public expectations rise, government agencies are rethinking how they connect with their communities. It's no longer just about showing up in times of crisis - proactive outreach is becoming essential. By getting ahead of the conversation, agencies can build trust, strengthen relationships, and drive meaningful engagement.

Drawing on our playbook for Canva for Government, we've pulled together five key lessons. These insights can help you strengthen your messaging, build stronger community connections, and keep citizens informed and engaged.

Whether you're responding to a public health emergency or improving everyday engagement, these tips can help you create more meaningful conversations with the people you serve.

Source: Company Website

+ CANVA NAMED ON CNBC'S 2025 DISRUPTOR 50 LIST

We're proud to share that Canva has been named the #5 company on CNBC's 2025 Disruptor 50 list - a recognition of private companies transforming industries and reshaping the future of work.

Since launching in 2013, our mission has been to empower the world to design. From individuals and small businesses to global enterprises, we've built a platform that unlocks creativity and collaboration for everyone, no matter their design experience.

This recognition reflects our continued growth and innovation, including new AI-powered tools, innovative workplace solutions, and the expansion of our global team.

Source: Company Website

+ CANVA REPORT: WHY DATA STORYTELLING IS THE SKILL EVERY TEAM NEEDS NOW

When I was a climate journalist, I spent hours staring at numbers, trying to wrangle raw data into something people could actually understand, let alone care about. That challenge stuck with me. Years later, it became the spark for founding Flourish: a platform to help anyone - not just data experts - make sense of complexity through clear, visual storytelling.

That need is now greater than ever.

In a world increasingly driven by data, teams are expected to make faster, smarter decisions - backed by insights, not instinct. But what happens when data feels out of reach, buried in spreadsheets, or too complex to communicate?

Our global study, Beyond the Numbers: How Data Storytelling Redefines Communication, reveals a growing confidence gap between data's potential and professionals'. Based on insights from more than 2,400 marketing and sales professionals across eight countries - including the United States, United Kingdom, France, Germany, Spain, Australia, India, and Japan - the research highlights a critical opportunity: empowering teams with intuitive tools and the skills to tell meaningful stories with data.

Source: Company Website

+ AI IN ACTION: PRACTICAL STRATEGIES FROM CANVA AND HUBSPOT TEAMS

AI is transforming how teams work - but it's not just about speed. In this webinar recap, leaders from Canva, HubSpot and more share how they're using AI to rethink marketing and customer experience. From real-world wins to common roadblocks, here's what they've learned so far.

AI is already reshaping how business teams work - and in marketing and customer success, the shift goes beyond efficiency. It's about moving faster, connecting more meaningfully, and staying focused on what matters most.

In a recent webinar co-hosted by Canva and HubSpot, leaders from both companies shared how their teams are putting AI into action, the results they're seeing, and the lessons learned along the way.

Source: Company Website

+ CANVA CELEBRATING 10 MILLION TREES PLANTED THROUGH ONE PRINT, ONE TREE

When we launched Canva Print, we wanted every order to make a positive impact. Through our One Print, One Tree initiative, we've now planted over 10 million trees - restoring landscapes, supporting communities, and helping build climate resilience around the world.

When we launched Canva Print in 2021, we knew it would have a footprint. However, we also saw an opportunity: what if we could help restore the planet with every Print order?

That idea became One Print, One Tree: our commitment to plant a tree for every Canva Print order. What began as a simple promise has since grown into a global reforestation program - focused not just on planting trees, but on restoring landscapes, supporting communities, conserving habitats for wildlife, and contributing to long-term climate resilience.

Source: Company Website

+ WHAT'S NEW IN CANVA EDUCATION: BUILT WITH TEACHERS, FOR TEACHERS

We truly believe every teacher deserves tools that are powerful, intuitive, and built for the real challenges of the classroom. At Canva Create 2025, we introduced a powerful new set of features built to support every teacher and engage every learner - whether you're planning lessons, personalizing learning, or finding new ways to bring content to life.

Inspired by real feedback from our educator community, these tools help make teaching more creative, engaging, and efficient - all in one easy-to-use platform. From AI-powered planning to interactive content and smarter insights, these updates are here to help you spend less time on admin, and more time doing what you do best: teaching.

Source: Company Website

+ CANVA JOURNALISM IN THE VISUAL AGE: A FRONT ROW SEAT TO THE FUTURE OF STORYTELLING

Journalism is evolving - fast. Deadlines are tighter, platforms are multiplying, and expectations are rising. But one thing hasn't changed: the power of a well-told story.

Last week in New York City, we brought together more than 150 journalists, editors, and media professionals for Journalism in the Visual Age - our first-ever community-led event designed specifically for the journalism and media community. Centered on one core idea, the event aimed to give working journalists real tools, timely inspiration, and fresh ideas to support their craft in today's visual-first world.

Here are the top takeaways.

Source: Company Website

+ CELEBRATING EXTRAORDINARY EDUCATORS: CANVA AND CBS HONOR 5 TEACHERS MAKING A DIFFERENCE

Since the beginning, we've been on a mission to empower the world to design meaningful change - in classrooms, workplaces, and communities everywhere. As part of that mission, Canva Education is available 100% free for teachers and students, helping millions bring creativity into learning every day.

Now, we're proud to team up with CBS and journalist David Begnaud to spotlight five extraordinary educators whose impact reaches well beyond their schools. Here's everything you need to know about this heartwarming moment.

Shining a light on unsung heroes Designed to celebrate the everyday heroes whose stories often go untold, our latest partnership with CBS is our way of saying thank you to the educators who guide, uplift, and ignite a lifelong love of learning.

Source: Company Website

+ WHAT'S NEW FOR CANVA IN JAPAN

From bold brand moments to community connections, Canva's momentum in Japan keeps growing. With a deep focus on local creativity and collaboration, we're proud to see our platform empowering more individuals, educators, and businesses across the country.

At Canva, we believe everyone should feel empowered to bring their ideas to life - and it's been incredible to see millions of people around the world unlocking their creativity and achieving their goals with Canva, wherever they may be. Japan is no exception.

We've doubled our growth in Japan over the past year, a true testament to the increasing demand for accessible, intuitive visual communication tools. With over 170 million designs created on Canva, Japan continues to be one of our fastest-growing markets globally. To keep up with this amazing momentum, we opened our new office in Shibuya - the epicenter of Tokyo's creative scene - now home to our growing team.

Source: Company Website

+ FROM CANVA TO CAMPAIGN: CREATING LINKEDIN ADS JUST GOT EASIER

The new LinkedIn Ads app for Canva is here, giving marketers a more seamless way to create and publish ad campaigns. This integration lets teams design video and image ads in Canva and export them directly to LinkedIn Campaign Manager - streamlining the path from concept to campaign.

In today's fast-moving marketing world, teams are under pressure to deliver more content - faster and without sacrificing quality. As strategies shift and channels grow, the need for high-impact creative that's easy to produce and scale has never been clearer.

That's where the new LinkedIn Ads app for Canva comes in.

Available now to our entire Canva community, the app is designed to streamline how marketing teams create and publish LinkedIn ad campaigns, connecting Canva's visual communication platform directly with LinkedIn Campaign Manager. From first draft to final asset, it's now easier than ever to move from idea to impact.

Source: Company Website

NASDAQ STOCK REPORT

Tetra Tech's trailing twelve months dividend is 24.60c. Its dividend yield at its current price is 0.69%. Its current price is at a 29.58% discount to its 52 week high. Its current price is at a 31.8% premium to its 52 week low. If Tetra Tech was to return to its 52 week low its dividend yield would be 0.91%.

$1000 invested into Tetra Tech stock 5 years ago would be worth $2,042 today. This total gain of $1,042 is generated by a capital gain of $985 and dividends of $57.

Tetra Tech's dividend has grown 12.67% over the last 4 years.

Activities

Tetra Tech, Inc. is a leading global provider of consulting and engineering services, headquartered in Pasadena, California. The company primarily generates its revenue from two core segments: Government Services Group (GSG) and Commercial/International Services Group (CIG). The GSG, which accounts for the largest portion of revenue, focuses on providing technical services to U.S. federal, state, and local government agencies, including water resource management, environmental restoration, and infrastructure support. The CIG segment serves commercial clients and international markets with similar expertise in water, environment, and energy solutions. Among its fastest-growing areas, Tetra Tech has seen significant expansion in renewable energy projects, particularly in wind and solar infrastructure, as well as climate resilience and disaster recovery services, driven by increasing global demand for sustainable solutions. With a strong commitment to innovation, Tetra Tech continues to address complex challenges in water, environment, and infrastructure for a diverse client base worldwide. It is the NASDAQ's 5th largest Consumer product/services company by market capitalisation.

TETRA TECH PRESS RELEASES AND CORPORATE WIRE

August 01: Tetra Tech quarterly dividends steady

Tetra Tech today announced a quarterly dividend of 6.50c per share for Q3/2025; unchanged from the previous quarter (Q2/2025) dividend of 6.50c. The ex-dividend date is Friday, August 15, 2025 and the record date is Friday, August 15, 2025 and it is payable on Friday, August 29. Total dividends per share paid in the 12 months ended August 01 were 19.26c. This reflects actual dividend yield of 0.5% at the last price of $36.74.

urn:contentItem:6GH3-0XG3-RV2T-00MT-00000-00WEEKLY ROUNDUP: KIIT UNIVERSITY NEWS THIS PAST WEEK AUG 14, 20252025-08-15T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T07:00:52ZLexisNexisWEEKLY ROUNDUP: KIIT UNIVERSITY NEWS THIS PAST WEEK AUG 14, 2025

+ KIIT UNIVERSITY [10 Press Releases]

+ KIIT UNIVERSITY: KINS CELEBRATES WORLD BREASTFEEDING WEEK

The Child Health Nursing department of KINS under KIIT-DU celebrated World Breastfeeding Week 2025 from 1st August to 7th August 2025 with the theme "Prioritise Breastfeeding: Create Sustainable Support Systems". It was attended by GNM 2nd year, B. Sc. Nursing 6th semester, MSc Nursing 1st year and 2nd year, including KINS faculties.

Source: Company Website

+ GREED IS THE ROOT OF DECLINING SOCIAL VALUES, WARNS JUSTICE SANTOSH HEGDE SPEAKING AT KIIT LAW SCHOOL

Greed is a disease for which there is no medicine, and it is at the root of the fall in our social values, said former judge of Supreme Court and retired Karnataka Lokayukta Justice N Santosh Hegde. In a powerful and candid address at KIIT Law School on "Fall in Social Values and Its Consequences", Justice Hegde lamented how the relentless pursuit of money and power has eroded moral integrity and weakened society's foundations.

Source: Company Website

+ KIIT UNIVERSITYKSOM HOSTS 16TH NATIONAL HR CONCLAVE

KIIT School of Management (KSOM) hosted its 16th National HR Conclave on August 9, 2025, themed "Navigating the Hybrid Future: Agile, Adaptive, and Integrated Workplaces." The conclave highlighted the strategies for building flexible, resilient, and human-centric organizations in a hybrid era. Dr. Achyuta Samanta, Founder, KIIT, KISS & KIMS graced the occasion and interacted with the corporate dignitaries.

Delivering the keynote address at the conclave, Mr. Sarthak Behuria, Chairman & Chairperson of the Board of Directors, Reliance BP Mobility Ltd. noted that the traditional 9-to-5 is giving way to a new era of work defined by agility, adaptability, and empathy. Drawing from his vast experience, he shared a few real-life instances that illustrated these values in action. His speech was deeply humane and personal, reflecting the importance of trust and connection in today's workplace.

Prof. Saranjit Singh, Vice Chancellor, KIIT Deemed to be University, highlighted that the theme of hybrid workplaces and the hybrid future can be captured in three words: agile, adaptive, and integrated. Drawing parallels between industry and academia, he noted that education has also been disrupted by market changes, making agility and adaptability essential for institutions to thrive. He spoke about the growing influence of artificial intelligence and the need to adapt to its impact on education and work.

Source: Company Website

+ KIIT UNIVERSITY KINS FACULTY INVITED AS A SPEAKER FOR FDP

Prof Asokan R, HOD of Medical Surgical Nursing and Incharge of R&D at KINS, was invited as a distinguished speaker for the Faculty Development Programme organized by the GITAM Institute of Nursing, GITAM Deemed to be University, Visakhapatnam. This event was held on 30th July 2025 and attended by various nursing specialists.

The speaker delivered an insightful session on the topic "Professional Development and Accountability" highlighting the evolving roles of nursing faculty in the academic and clinical domains. The session focused on the importance of continuous professional growth, ethical responsibilities, and maintaining accountability in nursing practice. Real world examples and current trends in nursing education were integrated into the presentation making it engaging and thought provoking for the participants.

Source: Company Website

+ KIIT UNIVERSITY: EMPOWERING HANDS FOR LITTLE LIVES: KIMS SCHOOL OF PHYSIOTHERAPY HOSTS ADVANCED WORKSHOP ON PAEDIATRIC FUNCTIONAL THERAPY MODULE- II

A transformative two-day Workshop on Paediatric Functional Therapy Module-II (Advanced Level) was successfully conducted at the KIMS School of Physiotherapy, bringing together leading minds and eager professionals from across the country to delve deep into paediatric neuro-rehabilitation.

Source: Company Website

+ EMPOWERING HANDS FOR LITTLE LIVES: KIMS SCHOOL OF PHYSIOTHERAPY HOSTS ADVANCED WORKSHOP ON PAEDIATRIC FUNCTIONAL THERAPY MODULE- II

A transformative two-day Workshop on Paediatric Functional Therapy Module-II (Advanced Level) was successfully conducted at the KIMS School of Physiotherapy, bringing together leading minds and eager professionals from across the country to delve deep into paediatric neuro-rehabilitation.

The inaugural session began on August 2 in the presence of the Medical Superintendent Dr. Manas Ranjan Behara, KIMS, the Director Brig. Dr Ambika Mohanty, KIMS, and Principal of KIMS School of Physiotherapy Dr. Birupakhya Mahakul. Their powerful words underscored the significance of advancing paediatric therapeutic skills and lauded the institution's commitment to hands-on clinical excellence.

The workshop was led by Dr. Amit Barua (MPT, SVNIRTAR) Certified in Sensory Integration, NDT, OPT, Autism Movement Therapy (USA), Halliwick (London) Director, Little Seed Clinic, Raipur.

Source: Company Website

+ KIIT VICE CHANCELLOR RECEIVES AWARD FOR CSR INITIATIVES AT 15TH CSR LEADERSHIP SUMMIT 2024

Prof. (Dr.) Saranjit Singh, Vice Chancellor, KIIT-DU received an award at the prestigious 15th CSR Leadership Summit 2025 on the theme "Fostering CSR in Odisha: Showcasing Odisha's Pioneering CSR Initiatives".

The summit aims to highlight the transformative potential of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) in addressing Odisha's societal challenges. It brings together corporate leaders, policymakers, and community stakeholders to discuss and amplify the success of Odisha's groundbreaking CSR projects.

Prof. Singh graced the Leadership Summit as the Guest of Honour. During his address, he highlighted the contribution of Dr. Achyuta Samanta, Founder, KIIT, KISS & KIMS, and his pivotal role in driving CSR initiatives through his institutions, particularly the Kalinga Institute of Social Sciences (KISS).

Source: Company Website

+ KIIT UNIVERSITYKISS-DU HOSTS DISTINGUISHED INVITED LECTURE SERIES

KISS Deemed to be University hosted Distinguished Invited Lecture Series on 22nd January 2025. Professor Shelly Meyer, an International Business Professor at Lindenwood University, Missouri, and Professor Timothy Hatten, a Business Professor at Colorado Mesa University jointly spoke on "Community-Driven Success: Indigenous Entrepreneurship and Sustainability" and in a parallel session Professor Andrew Ogram, a Professor of Soil Microbiology, University of Florida discussed the critical interplay between soil microbes and plant health, particularly in the rhizosphere-the dynamic soil region influenced by plant roots.

The first parallel session comprised deliberations from Professor Shelly Meyer and Professor Timothy Hatten. They gave insights on achieving success as Indigenous entrepreneurs and presented a three-step framework for sustainable entrepreneurship, consisting of Process Innovation, Triggering Events, and Implementation. Their deliberations emphasized the importance of community-driven approaches, adaptability, and the effective use of local resources. The speakers encouraged the attendees to explore innovative solutions that cater specifically to Indigenous needs, while balancing cultural preservation with economic development.

Source: Company Website

+ EVENTS CALENDAR: INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON BLUE ECONOMY HELD AT KIIT

The International Conference on Blue Economy in collaboration with Bhubaneswar City Knowledge Innovation Cluster (BCKIC), BRIC-ILS and IIT Ropar brought together over 800 participants, including policymakers, researchers, and students from across the globe, to discuss the potential of marine ecosystems in advancing sustainable growth. The event was marked by insightful discussions, exhibitions, and a renewed focus on leveraging Odisha's maritime heritage and resources. The event also showcased 50 startup companies specializing in marine biotechnology, aquaculture, and tourism, reflecting Odisha's growing prominence in the blue economy landscape.

Highlighting Odisha's rich maritime history, Pravati Parida Dy. Chief Minister of Odisha emphasized the state's strategic importance in India's blue economy vision. She said that with an extensive coastline of over 500 km, Odisha is poised to play a significant role in advancing India's maritime sector.

Dr. Rajesh Gokhle, Secretary of the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India, highlighted the economic significance of harnessing marine resources. "Marine ecosystems provide an economic engine that includes fisheries, tourism, and biotechnology, contributing billions annually," he said.

Source: Company Website

+ KIIT UNIVERSITYKSRM ORGANIZES TALK ON "DESIGNING, MANAGING, IMPLEMENTING AND MONITORING OF CLIMATE RESILIENCE PROJECTS"

The placement committee of KIIT School of Rural Management (KSRM) organized a talk on "Designing, Managing, Implementing and Monitoring of Climate Resilience Projects" on 24th January, 2025. The talk was delivered by Mr. Debaraj Behera, who has been associated with The World Bank as an Agriculture and Livelihood Expert under Global Agriculture and Food Security Programme (GAFSP), Social Sustainability and Inclusion (SSI) Global Practice, Environment, Natural Resources, and BlueEconomy (ENB) Global Practice. In his talk, Mr. Behera emphasized the importance of drought mitigation strategies like millet cultivation, goat rearing, and large livestock management in semi-arid areas. To build resilience, he recommended diversifying livelihoods to provide communities with alternative income sources, enhancing their adaptive capacity. Mr. Debaraj highlighted key preventive and curative measures such as implementing vaccination programs, and constructing resilient housing for animals to withstand climate extremes. Additionally, he stressed training communities on improved agricultural practices, introducing climate-resilient seeds, and integrating technology.

Source: Company Website

NASDAQ STOCK REPORT

Tetra Tech (NASDAQ:TTEK), the NASDAQ's 4th largest Consumer product/services company by market cap, is down 7% Year to Date. There have been changes in analyst ratings and target prices in 2025 - some forward-looking and others that have been after price movements. The Created Market Value multiple, defined by the change in MCap for every $1 of retained earnings is exemplary at $4.68.

Activities

Tetra Tech, Inc. is a leading global provider of consulting and engineering services, headquartered in Pasadena, California. The company primarily generates its revenue from two core segments: Government Services Group (GSG) and Commercial/International Services Group (CIG). The GSG, which accounts for the largest portion of revenue, focuses on providing technical services to U.S. federal, state, and local government agencies, including water resource management, environmental restoration, and infrastructure support. The CIG segment serves commercial clients and international markets with similar expertise in water, environment, and energy solutions. Among its fastest-growing areas, Tetra Tech has seen significant expansion in renewable energy projects, particularly in wind and solar infrastructure, as well as climate resilience and disaster recovery services, driven by increasing global demand for sustainable solutions. With a strong commitment to innovation, Tetra Tech continues to address complex challenges in water, environment, and infrastructure for a diverse client base worldwide. It is the NASDAQ's 4th largest Consumer product/services company by market capitalisation.

TETRA TECH PRESS RELEASES AND CORPORATE WIRE

August 01: Tetra Tech quarterly dividends steady

Tetra Tech today announced a quarterly dividend of 6.50c per share for Q3/2025; unchanged from the previous quarter (Q2/2025) dividend of 6.50c. The ex-dividend date is Friday, August 15, 2025 and the record date is Friday, August 15, 2025 and it is payable on Friday, August 29. Total dividends per share paid in the 12 months ended August 01 were 19.26c. This reflects actual dividend yield of 0.5% at the last price of $36.74.

urn:contentItem:6GJC-GC63-RV8Y-74YV-00000-00Tetra Tech's Earnings Growth Lags Granite Construction2025-08-21T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T07:00:52ZLexisNexisTetra Tech's Earnings Growth Lags Granite Construction

NASDAQ STOCK REPORT

Tetra Tech's growth in EPS (earnings per share) has been 13.2% annualized over 3 years. Over the same time period its stock price has gone up 25.4% or 8.3% annualized.

In comparison, Granite Construction's growth in EPS (earnings per share) has been 135.7% annualized over 3 years. Over the same time period its stock price has gone up 255.4% or 0% annualized.

Tetra Tech's last trading price was $35.66 which implies a Price to Earnings multiple of 41. With an EPS growth rate of 13.2 that implies a PEG ratio (price/earnings to growth) of 3.11 when using the EPS growth rate of the past 3 years (investors prefer using a 3-year expected growth rate instead but each investor will have a different perspective on future growth).

Granite Construction's last trading price was $108.61 which implies a Price to Earnings multiple of 37.7. With an EPS growth rate of 135.7 that implies a PEG ratio (price/earnings to growth) of 0.28 when using the EPS growth rate of the past 3 years (investors prefer using a 3-year expected growth rate instead but each investor will have a different perspective on future growth).

Insurance Australia Group (NRM: EUR4.72) increases on rising relative strength

Insurance Australia Group Ltd's (FRA: NRM EUR4.72) stock price increased 4.0c (0.9%) from its previous trading session to close at EUR4.72.

Compared with the DAX Index which fell 22.2 points (0.09%) in the day, the relative price increase was 0.9%.

In the German market, the stock's relative price strength percentile is rising at 30 for 6 months, 44 for 3 months, and 48 for 1 month. A price rise combined with a rising relative strength is a bullish signal.

SECTION 2 RISES PROPELLED BY HIGH VOLUMES

Insurance Australia (IAG: US$A8.59) lifts 1.2% on firm volume

Insurance Australia Group Limited's (ASX: IAG US$A8.59) stock price lifted 10.0c (1.2%) from its previous trading session to close at US$A8.59.

Compared with the All Ordinaries Index which rose 46.0 points (0.5%) in the day, the relative price increase was 0.7%.

In the past five days trading has been on consistently high volumes; Volume Index (VI) has been 1.1 or higher.

SECTION 4 THE PAST YEAR: PRESS RELEASES

4.1 Press Releases and Corporate Wire

Press Release article 1 of 4, Source: WEC, 45 words

February 18: Insurance Australia announces dividend

Insurance Australia today announced an interim dividend of 12.0c per share, franked to 60%. The ex-dividend date is Tuesday, February 18, 2025 and it is payable on Friday, March 07.

Press Release article 2 of 4, 31 words

September 16 2024: Insurance Australia announces AGM

Insurance Australia has announced its Annual General Meeting will take place on Thursday, October 24.

Press Release article 3 of 4, Source: Company Website, 291 words

August 22 2024: IAG releases Climate Action Plan

The Climate Action Plan includes IAG's updated FY30 emissions reduction interim targets and outlines how IAG is supporting the transition towards a low-carbon, climate resilient economy.

IAG Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer, Nick Hawkins said, "The need to act on climate change has never been more urgent and we're proud to play our part. Our Climate Action Plan demonstrates our commitment to helping customers and communities in Australia and New Zealand adapt to a changing climate and transition to a net zero future."

With the goal to become a net zero insurer by 2050, IAG is working to achieve net zero emissions across its operations, while actively strengthening climate resilience and capturing opportunities through the transition.

IAG's Climate Action Plan is focused on three key action areas:

1. Adapting its direct operations

IAG is focused on lowering scope 1 and 2 emissions to meet a science aligned 1.5C pathway and transitioning its direct operations to build climate resilience.

2. Supporting its value chain

Recognising that its influence extends beyond its immediate operations, IAG is using its knowledge and reach to help accelerate the transition to net zero across its full value chain, supporting customers, suppliers and partners.

3. Collaborating and advocating

Driving systemic change through its partnerships and advocacy work, IAG is supporting communities to build climate resilience and is sharing its understanding of climate risks and opportunities by partnering with governments, industry, and other organisations.

As detailed in the Climate Action Plan, IAG has updated its emissions reduction interim targets to net zero scope 1 and 2 emissions by FY30 from a FY24 baseline and it will also reduce limited upstream operational scope 3 emissions by 50% from a FY24 baseline.

Press Release article 4 of 4, Source: Company Website, 311 words

August 21 2024: IAG FY24 Results

Results overview IAG today announced its 2024 full-year results, reporting a net profit after tax (NPAT) of $898m, up 7.9% on FY23. This increase was driven by an 11% rise in net earned premiums, an improvement in the insurance profit, and higher investment income on shareholder funds of $286m up 35% on the previous year.

The insurance profit of $1,438m was up 79.1% on FY23 and equated to a reported margin of 15.6% (FY23: 9.6%). The company's natural perils costs of $983m, $115m below the $1098m allowance, positively impacted the insurance profit.

The IAG Board declared a final dividend of 17.0cps (FY23: 9cps) bringing the full year dividend to 27cps (FY23: 15cps).

Commenting on the company's performance, IAG Managing Director and CEO Nick Hawkins said:

"Today's result reflects the strength of the IAG business as well as the operational improvements we have implemented. The trust our customers have in our brands is reflected in continued high customer advocacy and retention in our retail businesses in Australia and New Zealand. We are well positioned to continue supporting our customers and the broader economy.

"The strategic measures we have put in place over the past few years have created a stronger and more resilient IAG. We've streamlined our Australian business, established a clear brand strategy and launched NRMA Insurance nationally, outside of Victoria. We have also improved our claims management capability to ensure we are well placed to support our customers when they need us the most.

"We've delivered on our target of at least $250m in insurance profit from our Intermediated Insurance Australia business, and significantly improved our technology platform that delivers the products and services we provide to our retail customers.

"New Zealand saw a material uplift in our pricing capability and risk management as we migrated policies to the Enterprise Platform.

SECTION 5 TODAY'S BULLISH SIGNALS

5.1 3-DAY: MODERATE MOMENTUM UP

IAG adds 5.0% on firm volume 1.4 times average. Compared with the All Ordinaries Index which rose 31.5 points (or 0.3%) in the 3-days, the relative price increase was 4.7%.

The price ranged between a high of $A8.59 on Thursday Aug 14 and a low of $A8.49 on Wednesday Aug 13.

5.2 Uptrend

Price/Moving Average Price of 1.04:

- The Price/MAP 200 for Insurance Australia is 1.04. Being higher than 1 is a bullish indicator. The stock is trading above both its MAPs and the 50-day MAP of $A8.70 is higher than the 200-day MAP of $A8.27, a second bullish indicator. The 200-day MAP has increased to $A8.27, a third bullish indicator.

- In the last three months the stock has hit a new 52-week high twice.

The Best 3 weeks in the past quarter

In the past quarter the week beginning Monday July 28 saw the highest weekly rise of 2.8% for a relative price increase of 3%.

5.3 Other Bullish Signals

- Return on Equity of 14.5% versus sector average of 12.4% and market average of 4.1%.

- Return on Assets of 4% versus sector average of 2.3% and market average of 0.8%.

- Return on Capital Employed of 18.4% versus sector average of 5.7% and market average of 1.7%.

MCap/Total Assets:

- Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 0.8. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued.

- As per the Du Pont analysis, Return on Equity of 14.5% is better than sector average of 12.4%. This is computed as net profit margin of 89.4% times asset turnover [sales/assets] of 0.05 times leverage factor [total assets/shareholders' equity] of 3.6.

SECTION 6 ONGOING BULLISH PARAMETERS

6.1 Past three-years

- Insurance Australia rose for a third consecutive year. In the past three years it has risen $A4.35 (102.6%).

6.2 Past quarter momentum up: Insurance Australia lifts 2.0% on below average volume 0.8 times average.

6.3 The Best Periods [1 Yr, 3 Yrs] with Price Change % > 23.1

3-Year price change of 102.6% for Insurance Australia outperformed the change of 25.5% in the All Ordinaries Index for a relative price change of 77%.

6.4 Created Market Value [CMV] past 5 yrs of $A8.5 billion

- Market Capitalization has increased by $A8.5 billion from $A11.8 billion to $A20.3 billion in the last 5 years. This increase comprises cumulative retained earnings (RETE) of $A16 million and Created Market Value of $A8.5 billion. The Created Market Value multiple, defined by the change in MCap for every AUD1 of retained earnings is exemplary at $A530.87.

6.5 Growth in annual dividends per share and earnings per share

- Insurance Australia sees dividend rise for a second consecutive year

Insurance Australia reported dividends per share of 29.0c in the past year, up 52.6% from the previous year. This is the second consecutive dividend increase. In the past 2 years average annual compound growth rate of dividends was 62.4%.

- EPS growth [FY2024 vs FY2023] of 8.8%.

6.6 Annualised Period-based Total Shareholder Returns [TSR %]: The Best Periods with TSR > 17.7%

6.7 Low Debt to Equity (%)

The debt to equity ratio of 41.3% is under a safe benchmark figure of 50%. However, it has deteriorated from 37.4% a year ago.

6.8 Increased VWAP, up 86% in 5 years

In the past five years Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) has increased by 86.1% to $A8.0. Based on a dynamic start date of five years ago, there have been declines in VWAP in 2 out of 5 years.

6.9 Increased share turnover, up 37% in 5 years

In the past five years, average daily share turnover has increased 36.7% to $A38.1 million. This suggests increased liquidity.

6.10 Satisfies two criteria of Benjamin Graham

- "A dividend yield of at least two-thirds the triple-A bond yield"; the stock's dividend yield is 0.8 times the triple-A bond yield of 4.3%.

-""Total debt less than tangible book value""; total debt of AUD2.9 billion (US$2.0 billion) is less than tangible book value of AUD3.4 billion (US$2.2 billion).

6.11 Satisfies 5 out of 9 criteria of Joseph Piotroski [pass mark 5]:

- Positive net income.

- Positive operating cashflow.

- Return on Assets improvement [from 3.7% to 4.0%].

- Good quality of earnings [operating cashflow exceeds net income].

- Reduction in total shares on issue.

But does not meet the following 4 criteria of Joseph Piotroski:

- Improvement in long-term debt to total assets.

- Improvement in current ratio.

- Improvement in gross margin.

- Improvement in asset turnover.

SECTION 7 TODAY'S BEARISH SIGNALS

Price/Earnings/Growth:

- Price/Earnings/Growth of 2.63 (based on the year-on-year growth in trailing 12 months EPS of 8.8%) versus sector average of 0.8.

Price to Book of 6 > Insurance sector (of 13 stocks) average of 3.6:

- The Price to Book of 6 indicates overvaluation compared with sector average of 3.6 and 3.8 for the Australian Market.

7.1 Downtrend

Negative MACD:

- The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) indicator of 12-day Exponential Moving Average (EMA) of 8.56 minus the 26-day EMA of 8.59 is negative, suggesting a bearish signal.

7.2 Other Bearish Signals

- Total Liabilities/EBITDA of 12.4 is more than 5, this compares unfavourably with the Joseph Piotroski benchmark of 5.

SECTION 8 ONGOING BEARISH PARAMETERS

8.1 Total Shares on Issue: 5-Year Increase of 19.7%

In the past 5 years total shares on issue have increased by 458 million (19.7%) from 2.3 billion to 2.8 billion. Buybacks have averaged 19.8 million shares [0.9%] per financial year. Based on a dynamic start date of 5 years ago, there have been declines in issued capital in 2 out of 5 years. An increase in total shares on issue is an unfavourable indicator in Joseph Piotroski's 9 indicators.

8.2 P/E/G > 1

The price earnings ratio of 23.2 divided by trailing twelve months eps growth of 8.8% corresponds to P/E/G of 2.6 times.

EPS Growth (%)8.82P/E/G2.63P/E23.22

8.3 Declining Volume, down 25% in 5 years

In the past five years, Average Daily Volume of Trading (ADVT) has decreased 25.4% to 4.9 million shares.

With an EPS growth rate of 4.1 that implies a PEG ratio (price/earnings to growth) of 6.06 when using the EPS growth rate of the past 3 years (investors prefer using a 3-year expected growth rate instead but each investor will have a different perspective on future growth).

The Created Market Value multiple, defined by the change in MCap for every $1 of retained earnings is exemplary at $4.46.

Activities

Tetra Tech, Inc. is a leading global provider of consulting and engineering services, headquartered in Pasadena, California. The company primarily generates its revenue from two core segments: Government Services Group (GSG) and Commercial/International Services Group (CIG). The GSG, which accounts for the largest portion of revenue, focuses on providing technical services to U.S. federal, state, and local government agencies, including water resource management, environmental restoration, and infrastructure support. The CIG segment serves commercial clients and international markets with similar expertise in water, environment, and energy solutions. Among its fastest-growing areas, Tetra Tech has seen significant expansion in renewable energy projects, particularly in wind and solar infrastructure, as well as climate resilience and disaster recovery services, driven by increasing global demand for sustainable solutions. With a strong commitment to innovation, Tetra Tech continues to address complex challenges in water, environment, and infrastructure for a diverse client base worldwide. It is the NASDAQ's 5th largest Consumer product/services company by market capitalisation.

TETRA TECH PRESS RELEASES AND CORPORATE WIRE

August 01: Tetra Tech quarterly dividends steady

Tetra Tech today announced a quarterly dividend of 6.50c per share for Q3/2025; unchanged from the previous quarter (Q2/2025) dividend of 6.50c. The ex-dividend date is Friday, August 15, 2025 and the record date is Friday, August 15, 2025 and it is payable on Friday, August 29. Total dividends per share paid in the 12 months ended August 01 were 19.26c. This reflects actual dividend yield of 0.5% at the last price of $36.74.
